subject: Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests  (was: TestNG 4 and Data Providers)
msgSnippet: ... Yes, I think that every test needs a meaningful name.  Technically, a moniker.  Given the name/moniker of a failing test, it should be possible to
messageBody:
--- Robert Watkins <yahoo@t...> wrote:
> When you do parameterised tests in JUnit 3, you typically
> override the runTest method - this frees you up to set the
> name, as it won't be used for the reflection-based test
> running. I always make the test name something meaningful,
> based on the parameters coming in. A least effort approach
> would be to include the _number_ of the parameter
> (e.g. parameter set 5 of 10).

Yes, I think that every test needs a meaningful name. Technically,
a "moniker." Given the name/moniker of a failing test, it should be
possible to automatically recreate and rerun just that test. That is,
from "testThis(3 of 10)" or "testThis(5,'hello',true)", it should be
possible to construct and run a test instance equivalent to the
original. (And I'm saying "should" in the sense of, "The tool would
be most useful if it did things this way.")
